chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Katelynn E. McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must contact P&P by 4 p.m. on 8-17-22
Concurrent with: 21CF261

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 24 hours if one is received.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. Absolute sobriety at all times.  Random UA's per agent.  No possession of alcohol.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Katelynn E. McDonald not in court.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Katelynn E. McDonald.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Curran advises he recently spoke to DE who advised she was running late.  Court adjourns matter to 1:55 PM.  Back on the record at 1:50 PM.  DE now appears and all other appearances remain the same.  State states joint recommendation.  Atty Curran agrees.  Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Counts 2 - 7: Dismissed but read in 

Count 1:

36 months Probation, concurrent to 21CF261, must contact P&P by 4 p.m. on 8-17-22
0 days jail credit

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Provide DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety at all times
No possession of alcohol
Random UA's per agent
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and must report Rx to agent within 24 hours.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. 
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS), 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts 

Paperwork handed in court.
DE advised of charges and penalties.  NCP entered.  Court vacates the pleas.

Court quashes any warrant, if not previously done.  State states joint recommendation.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court vacates the pleas.  Matter will be set for trial.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Katelynn E. McDonald in court.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Katelynn E. McDonald.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Curran requests warrants ordered by quashed.  21CF261 is status, 22CF216 is waiver/argn and 21CM223 set for RD.  Court will leave 22CF216 on as scheduled.  21CF261 will be placed back on the JT calendar.  Atty Curran notes she will waive the prelim today in 22CF216 and proceed to a global resolution in all matters.  Court notes 21CM223 is already calendared for 8/5/22 but requests if he wants all matters to track that he reach out to her JA.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 22CF216.  DE agrees to waive prelim.  Court accepts waiver of prelim/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  22CF216 set for ARGN/plea/sent on 8/5/22 at 3pm w/21CM223.  21CF261 also to track.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:59 PM Defendant Katelynn E. McDonald in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Katelynn E. McDonald in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Katelynn E. McDonald appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE states she does qualify although Atty Hayes states she hasn't applied yet.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests signature bond w/conditions.  Atty Hayes responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No use or possession of any controlled substances w/o valid prescription and only if used as prescribed and absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
